page.title: 02PARISH CHURCH,ELMSTEAD.
page.content: Elmstead{Parish Church}is next to Elmstead{Hall.}It is mainly a{14th {century}building.One interesting feature of the church is the{wooden {effigy,}possibly of{Sir Thomas Weston. It dates from between 1345 and 1360. It is solid wood and the feet rest on a child's lap.Another feature is two tiny{windows}in the chapel dating back to the 14th century with the original glass intact.It was supposedly used by people who had a disease and were not allowed to come into the church. The latest addition to the church is an{octagonal extension}built in 1982.It is used for providing refreshments, meetings and Sunday school;40 people attend Sunday services and 30 children go to Sunday School.The present{incumbent}is the 70th. Vicar of Elmstead.
